title: January 9, 2024—KB5034134 (OS Build 10240.20402) - Microsoft Support
text:
January 9, 2024—KB5034134 (OS Build 10240.20402) - Microsoft Support 
 
 
January 9, 2024—KB5034134 (OS Build 10240.20402) 
Windows 10

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update addresses an issue that affects the ActiveX scroll bar. It does not work in IE mode. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
January 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5032390 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
.

summary:
KB5034134 is a security update released on January 9, 2024, targeting Windows 10, specifically OS Build 10240.20402. This update addresses security issues and includes quality improvements related to ActiveX scroll bar functionality in Internet Explorer mode. Administrators should ensure the latest servicing stack update (SSU), KB5032390, is applied before installing this cumulative update to enhance update reliability. Microsoft currently reports no known issues with this update.

**Technical Breakdown**:

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
This update addresses security vulnerabilities related to various components of Windows 10, enhancing the overall security posture.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- Before installation, confirm that SSU KB5032390 is installed:
  ```
  [Powershell]
  ```powershell
  Install-WindowsFeature -Name "KB5032390" -IncludeAllSubFeature
  ```

- Install KB5034134 through preferred methods:
  - **Windows Update and Microsoft Update**: Automatically managed.
  - **Windows Update for Business**: Managed based on configured policies.
  - **Standalone Installation**: Download from Microsoft Update Catalog.
  - **WSUS**: Sync by configuring the following:
    - Product: `Windows 10`
    - Classification: `Security Updates`
  
- For standalone retrieval, visit the Microsoft Update Catalog. 

No uninstallation instructions were provided for this update.
